dialogue.text: –Guys! –Help! Help!
Help!
–Eric! Eric! –What are you doing?
Help! Crisis-vamp!
Vamp! Vamp! Vamp!
What happened? Did she get triggered?
It’s okay. Don’t worry.
I actually thought it was pretty cool.
–Too bad I didn’t get it on video. –Thanks.
What is it?
I’m just scared that I won’t be allowed to dance anymore.
Forget about dancing. You can hang with us instead.
Blood and honor.
Cause we are young, wild, we are free
BST!
It's just the way that it's supposed to be
BST!

characters: Why your brother is so fucking creepy
You think we take cards or what
There has to be an ulterior motive
What the hell are you doing
Who the hell tricked her into that
Stop staring at me like that
Which one of you two is Didde
When am I getting my card back
No one has done it since
That was so cute what you wrote earlier
How do we get that then
Crazy that Kiara is having a party

dialogue.text: You’re far from home now. You’re lost.
No, I’m not. But maybe you are.
Why couldn’t we take the car?
I didn’t know it was this far. Calm down. Here they come.
–Seriously! –But don’t say anything stupid now.
–That’s me.
dialogue.speaker: Which one of you two is Didde

dialogue.text: Do you guys have any money then?
–My card? Why should we take mine?
dialogue.speaker: Give me the card

dialogue.text: Give me the card! Give it here!
Here.
–No… Or I don’t know…
dialogue.speaker: You think we take cards or what

dialogue.text: Of course we fucking take cards.
–Yeah, what’s your PIN? –3162.
Sweet. You’ll get it back tomorrow.
How the hell do you know my PIN?
I’ve seen you type it in once.
We’re friends. Don’t you trust me?
But I don’t know yours.
–Tomorrow. He said so.
dialogue.speaker: When am I getting my card back

dialogue.text: How are we supposed to get this home, were you thinking?
Have you ever thought about how fast I solve problems?
You’re fucking king, Didde! You’re fucking king, you know that?
–I scared you?!
dialogue.speaker: You scared me

dialogue.text: How did you get in?
What do you think? Through the door. The butler let me in.
What’s everyone going to say? –About what?
dialogue.speaker: What do you think

dialogue.text: I lost control and almost killed everyone yesterday.
Yeah, that’s true. They’re probably talking a lot of shit.
Oh, what have I done? I’m never going to be allowed to be in again.
They’ll soon have something new to talk about.
But maybe you should consider doing something to improve your reputation.
I know! I can have a party. Then maybe I’ll become more popular.
Party? You? Here?
–No, that’s not going to end well. –You might be right.
–I’m calling Elise.
dialogue.speaker: What are you doing

dialogue.text: I’m a woman who is a vampire. Red heart.
Hello?
–Hi! –What are you doing?
–Oh. But how are you?
dialogue.speaker: I just woke up

dialogue.text: Yeah, I’m okay I guess. A bit tired and stuff. And I’m dying of shame about yesterday.
But why? It wasn’t your fault.
I thought everyone hated me.
No, the sauna thing was clumsy. We should have thought of that.
But are you okay then?
–Yeah. Yeah, I’m okay.
dialogue.speaker: Hello

dialogue.text: How are you then? I saw what happened between you and Eric.
You saw? –Yeah. I saw you got sad.
dialogue.speaker: What

dialogue.text: He left right when you were going to kiss.
Yeah, I actually don’t know what I’m doing wrong anymore.
I think I know. I can help you if you want.
Okay. But can’t you come here then?
–I promised Dad I’d change the timing belt. –Yeah, I’m coming.
Okay, see you then. Bye.
–I’m going to Elise. –I’m coming with you.
–No, you’re not. –No.
–Yeah, like, how much do you think that cost?
dialogue.speaker: Kiara was so hot

dialogue.text: Did you see Kiara this weekend? What an ass!
What lights, man.
I didn’t know you could convert a car like that into an EPA.
How did that happen? Kiara suddenly became super popular.
Yeah, and now Alfred is popular too.
Is Kiara allowed in Batgirls now?
It’s not just because Chloe thinks Kiara is sassy now.
–Yeah, for sure.
dialogue.speaker: There has to be an ulterior motive

dialogue.text: Of course the whole school is talking shit about you now.
You got triggered and you almost killed Alfred.
–Yeah, but Elise said… –Don’t worry. I’ll help you.
Okay…
I know one thing you can do to get into Batgirls.
What? Tell me!
No, I don’t know if I want to put this on you.
Come on, just say it.
I understand if you don’t want to, but if I were you
I would have a party.
Or why? –Then everyone will like you again.
dialogue.speaker: Okay

dialogue.text: But you shouldn’t do anything just to become popular.
There! Yes! Exactly like that!
You’re so fucking good. Oh my god!
Miss the training! –It was worth it. Smile.
dialogue.speaker: What the fuck

dialogue.text: –Smart, right?
dialogue.speaker: What the hell are you doing

dialogue.text: You can take pictures without them spreading online.
Yeah, that’s smart. What the hell is this then?
It’s laughing gas.
–What the fuck, that’s coconut! –So what?
–I’m allergic to nuts. –But coconut isn’t a nut, Kevin.
But it is! Coconut nut.
You’re such a fucking party pooper. There’s no real coconut in it.
It’s additives that make it taste like coconut.
–Hey guys! –Yo.
You bought laughing gas? Are you three years old or what?
–There’s way better stuff.
dialogue.speaker: What

dialogue.text: –Oh.
dialogue.speaker: Vamp for example

dialogue.text: –Come to the party and you’ll see.
dialogue.speaker: How do we get that then

dialogue.text: There’s no coconut in it, right? Or…? Coconut…
Radio: Oh yes, today’s hits are presented by the Blood System.
...because Alfred has a bowl cut! Alfred is a nerd
It’s an iconic dance move. Scorpion to bridge.
–She’s wearing heels too. –That was her signature move.
–Are you kidding? No one?
dialogue.speaker: No one has done it since

dialogue.text: Rumor has it she was a vampire and the founder of Batgirls.
Okay, but if I know the choreography,
is it guaranteed that I’ll be in the final show then?
I think so. But if you ask Chloe
she only cares about looking hot and being popular.
But aren’t you the one who decides who gets to be in?
Well… We decide together.
I try to be fair, but Chloe is a bit more… you know.
If you just do what Chloe says, you’ll definitely get to be in.
Okay, but let’s run the choreography again.
Okay, but help me now. What should I reply to Eric?
–I can’t do that.
dialogue.speaker: Just say how you feel

dialogue.text: –You’re so unclear.
dialogue.speaker: He never replies anyway

dialogue.text: He doesn’t get it.
Affe, I think Elise is mad again.
Hello!
–Right in the middle of a match! –Jump in. I need help.
Help me. I don’t know what to reply.
What should I say? How many girls have I had?
You’ve been texting Anna Book’s daughter. You always have something to say.
Elise is impossible to understand.
It feels like I’ve done something again.
Please help me.
I go from being your best friend, to the nerd you hang out with
to being some fucking relationship coach.
Yeah, exactly like that. Help me!
Shit! It’s enough that I touch the phone and she’s already going.
“I want to be with you.”
Now I sent it. He’s not going to reply anyway.
Completely insane! It’s the first time Elise has written something I actually understand.
–I don’t need to reply to that. –No.
Sometimes women want men who take charge.
Watch and learn.
What the hell do we do now?
Zoom in! Zoom in!
–What the hell… –Calm down Eric, I’ve got this.
–She’s writing again. –“What are you wearing?”
No. No, Alfred. –Yes.
dialogue.speaker: What

dialogue.text: –Cowboy hat now.
dialogue.speaker: Absolutely not

dialogue.text: Watch and learn.
“Continuing at Kiara’s party.” What happens?
If nothing else happens I’m thinking of playing now.
–Super crazy.
dialogue.speaker: Crazy that Kiara is having a party

dialogue.text: Yeah, it’s crazy.
Kiara is having a party? –Yes.
dialogue.speaker: Kiara

dialogue.text: –No idea.
dialogue.speaker: Who the hell tricked her into that

dialogue.text: Shit! It looks like asthma medicine for bats.
It’s bats, not fladdermöss.
Stop being such a nerd, Kevin. Bending words and stuff.
How do you do it then?
It’s anti-trigger medicine for vampires.
–But you get the world’s biggest high. –Like laughing gas, kind of.
–It’s not dangerous, right? –Who cares if you get a high.
You’ll understand when you feel it.
All impressions become a hundred times bigger.
–It’s like an orgasm for the brain. –Nice!
You get one if you get more.
Okay, and where is that fucking party then?
Okay, we need to set the table, get snacks, good music and drinks.
Calm, calm, calm. Breathe.
We start with the most important: drinks. My cousin Kalle Blyfot solves that.
–No, we don’t need that. –No?
We’ve got it here.
–Yeah, here.
dialogue.speaker: What do you mean here

dialogue.text: –You’re joking. –Come on, let’s go down.
–No, no, we can’t go down there. –Yes we can.
–Shit, how cool this is. –You can take the lamp.
Can you see in the dark? –Yeah, I’m a vampire.
dialogue.speaker: What

dialogue.text: –Right. I forgot about that.
dialogue.speaker: Stop staring at me like that

dialogue.text: It’s fucking creepy. –Coward!
dialogue.speaker: Wait for me

dialogue.text: Holy shit! I was thinking maybe cider, but witch brew absolutely works.
Now tell me why you like vampires.
–When I can’t run away, you mean? –Yes. And be serious now.
–Stop, look at me. –Sorry.
–I can’t be bothered to tell the whole story. –Come on.
Okay then. It was winter. Me and Mom were on our way to Grandma.
Suddenly the car skidded and we ended up in the ditch.
Wow! What happened?
I barely remember. There was just blood everywhere.
I thought I was going to die.
Then suddenly a vampire came into the car.
But somehow it felt like he wanted to help me.
–No.
dialogue.speaker: Did he get triggered

dialogue.text: He just saved me somehow. Then the ambulance arrived.
Damn!
–Yeah. You guys swear.
dialogue.speaker: You swear

dialogue.text: I don’t fucking swear. Eric swears.
What kind of place is this?
An old sacrificial place and a secret escape route
from the time before humans and vampires made peace.
Before the blood pact and everything? –Yeah, long before that.
dialogue.speaker: What

dialogue.text: Back when vampires ate humans
and humans staked vampires to death.
–Now it’s your turn. –What?
–What?
dialogue.speaker: To tell something personal

dialogue.text: –Long story.
dialogue.speaker: Why your brother is so fucking creepy

dialogue.text: But he’s pissed because I’m going to inherit our family’s assets.
Because we vampires are matriarchal.
The youngest daughter inherits everything, including name and title.
So when you get married your husband has to change his name to Natt and Dag.
–And the money?
dialogue.speaker: Correct

dialogue.text: Everything.
Yeah, then you can understand why he’s a bit crooked.
Though he has a long time to save up.
Yeah, like 200 years.
–What?
dialogue.speaker: But something happened too

dialogue.text: Yeah, when he started high school.
It almost ended badly with a girl.
That’s why you’re not allowed to hang out with humans.
I am allowed to hang out with humans.
I mean hang out, really hang out with humans. Human guys.
Oh! They’re probably afraid I’ll fall in love with a human.
Is it that dangerous?
Is it true that vampires cry if they love someone?
Yes.
So you would have cried if you were in love with someone?
The party! Hello! We have to hurry.
–What the hell! Is it good? –Yeah, it’s good. You?
So cool that you came! –It’s so fucking cool.
dialogue.speaker: Here

dialogue.text: –Pleasure! –The snacks should be enough for everyone.
Yeah, no problem.
Hi!
–Hi! –Hi!
–Hey, do you know if Chloe is coming? –No. Why?
No, I mean it would have been fun if she was here.
Go to Eric now. He’s sitting there. Tell him you want him.
–I can’t do that. –Yes, go there now.
Tell him he looks hot tonight.
–You can’t trust your gut feeling. –Yes you can.
Hi.
–Hi! –You look so hot tonight!
–Then we have something in common.
dialogue.speaker: That was so cute what you wrote earlier

dialogue.text: –Yeah, it’s good.
dialogue.speaker: Is it good

dialogue.text: –Hi! –Hi.
–You don’t think the rumor will spread? –About what?
That I’m having a party, and uninvited guests show up.
No, you live in the middle of nowhere.
How do you even get here? Subway or what?
Kevin and Didde in the fucking house!
Hi Kiara! I brought some friends.
–Yo, gay boys! –Is this the national pocket ping-pong team?
Wait, I’ll help you. There! Kiss each other now.
What the hell?
It’s finished. I’m going to look for more.
Bingo!
Can everyone listen up for a second? Now we fucking go!
There we go!
It’s really loud in here.
–What?
dialogue.speaker: Should we go somewhere else

dialogue.text: –Come on, let’s go dance.
dialogue.speaker: Somewhere else

dialogue.text: Draw a razor blade.
–Should we…? –What?
–Should we…? –Okay.
